Article Title: IND vs SA: 'No right to interfere' — After ODI series win, India head coach Gautam Gambhir fires back at IPL team owner for criticism over Tests loss
Article Text:
Parth Jindal, Gautam Gambhir

Saurabh Netravalkar Interview: Gets emotional about playing at Wankhede, for USA; ILT20 and more

NEW DELHI: Indian men's cricket team head coach Gautam Gambhir on Saturday used the post-match press conference after the third ODI win against South Africa to respond to the criticism that followed India’s 2-0 Test series defeat.Gambhir said the reaction to the Test losses ignored key details. He said: "There were so many things said and written after we lost the Test series against South Africa, but nobody spoke about the fact that in the first Test we played without our captain, who didn't bat in either innings (Shubman Gill, who was out after playng three balls in the first innings due to neck injury) and we lost the match by just 30 runs. If you are going through a transition and lose your captain, who is also an in-form batter, it's tough. No one talked about this."Gambhir also responded to comments made by Delhi Capitals co-owner Parth Jindal, who had called for split coaching in Indian cricket after the Test series defeat. Gambhir said: "A lot was said. Even people who have nothing to do with cricket spoke up. An IPL owner also wrote about split captaincy." He added: "Everyone should remain in their domain. If we don't interfere in other's domain, then they don't have the right to interfere in our domain".Jindal had criticised India’s Test performance after the 2-0 loss against South Africa . He posted on X: "Not even close, what a complete thrashing at home! Don’t remember seeing our test side being so weak at home!!! This is what happens when red ball specialists are not picked." He also wrote: "This team is nowhere near reflective of the deep strength we possess in the red ball format. Time for India to move to a specialist red-ball coach for Test cricket."India defeated South Africa in the third ODI and sealed the ODI series 2-1. In the match, India won the toss and elected to field first, sending South Africa in to bat. The Proteas posted 270 all out in 47.5 overs. While chasing 271, India's batters put on an excellent show. Jaiswal remained unbeaten on 116, supported by Rohit's 75 and Virat Kohli's 65, guiding India to a comfortable nine-wicket victory and sealing the series 2-1.
Article Summary: India defeated South Africa in the third ODI and sealed the ODI series 2-1. Gautam Gambhir said the reaction to the Test losses ignored key details. He also responded to comments made by Delhi Capitals co-owner Parth Jindal.

Article Title: IND vs SA: Yashasvi Jaiswal celebrates maiden ODI ton in style; India thrash South Africa by 9 wickets to clinch series 2-1
Article Text:
India's Yashasvi Jaiswal (AP Photo/Mahesh Kumar A.)

Fans travel thousands of kilometres to watch Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma play

NEW DELHI: Yashasvi Jaiswal scored his first ODI century as India secured a 2-1 series victory with a dominant nine-wicket win against South Africa in Visakhapatnam on Saturday.India successfully chased the target of 271 runs, with Jaiswal remaining unbeaten at 116. He formed a crucial 155-run opening partnership with Rohit Sharma, who contributed 75 runs.Jaiswal celebrated his century after facing 111 balls in what was only his fourth ODI appearance since his debut this year. The 23-year-old left-handed batsman has now achieved centuries across all three international formats.Rohit Sharma initially led the batting charge while Jaiswal took time to settle. During his innings, Rohit achieved a milestone of 20,000 international runs, joining the elite company of Sachin Tendulkar, Virat Kohli, and Rahul Dravid.Keshav Maharaj dismissed Rohit after his 73-ball innings, which included seven fours and three sixes. Jaiswal then accelerated his scoring rate after reaching his fifty.Virat Kohli remained unbeaten on 65 off 45 balls, hitting six fours and three sixes. He finished the series with an impressive 302 runs and scored the winning boundary.India's bowling attack, led by Kuldeep Yadav and Prasidh Krishna with four wickets each, restricted South Africa to 270 runs in 47.5 overs.KL Rahul won India's first ODI toss after 20 consecutive losses and chose to field first. Quinton de Kock 's aggressive 106 off 89 balls, including eight fours and six sixes, helped South Africa reach a promising position at 168-2 before their batting collapsed.Krishna's double strike removed Matthew Breetzke for 24 and Aiden Markram for one. He later dismissed de Kock shortly after the batsman's century.Dewald Brevis and Marco Jansen attempted to stabilise the innings with a 35-run partnership. However, Kuldeep Yadav dismissed both batsmen in quick succession.Kuldeep finished with figures of 4-41, while Krishna's crucial wickets helped bowl out South Africa, with Maharaj remaining not out on 20.This ODI series victory follows India's 2-0 Test series defeat against South Africa. The team benefited from the presence of Kohli and Rohit, who now only participate in the 50-over format after retiring from T20Is and Tests.The teams will now compete in a five-match T20 series starting Tuesday in Cuttack.
Article Summary: Yashasvi Jaiswal scored his first ODI century as India beat South Africa. India secured a 2-1 series victory with a dominant nine-wicket win. The 23-year-old left-handed batsman has now achieved centuries across all three international formats.

Article Title: IND vs SA: ‘Not going anywhere’ - Rohit Sharma gets future backing after 3rd ODI show as India seal series 2-1
Article Text:
Rohit Sharma (AP Photo/Mahesh Kumar A.)

Fans travel thousands of kilometres to watch Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma play

Former Indian cricketers Mohammad Kaif and Irfan Pathan commended Rohit Sharma 's performance as he scored his 61st ODI fifty during the third match between India and South Africa in Visakhapatnam.Opening the innings with Jaiswal, Rohit scored 75 runs from 73 balls. The duo established a 155-run partnership at a run-a-ball pace while chasing 271.During his 75-run innings, the former Team India captain achieved the milestone of 20,000 international runs. His knock included seven fours and three sixes."Hitman isn't going anywhere! Has plenty left in the tank.. pillar of indian cricket ," Kaif posted on X.At 38 years old and having retired from Tests and T20Is, questions arose about Rohit's ODI future and his ability to perform until the 2027 World Cup. His recent form shows 340 runs in his last five ODI innings."Unreal consistency at the age of 38 by Rohit sharma. He is in total control," Irfan Pathan shared on X.Rohit's partnership with Yashasvi Jaiswal marked his 35th century opening stand in ODIs. This achievement places him second on the all-time list, behind only Sachin Tendulkar who has 40 such partnerships.India won the toss and chose to field first in the match. South Africa managed to score 270 runs before being dismissed in 47.5 overs.In the chase, India displayed impressive batting prowess. Jaiswal remained not out on 116 runs.Rohit contributed 75 runs while Virat Kohli added 65 runs to the total.India secured a comfortable nine-wicket victory, winning the series 2-1.
Article Summary: Rohit Sharma scored his 61st ODI fifty during the third match between India and South Africa in Visakhapatnam. The former Team India captain achieved the milestone of 20,000 international runs. India secured a comfortable nine-wicket victory, winning the series 2-1.

Article Title: Not Rohit Sharma or Suryakumar Yadav; Abhishek Sharma achieves what no Indian ever has in T20 cricket
Article Text:
Abhishek Sharma. (File photo)

Gautam Gambhir Press Conference: Team India head coach heaves fire after 2-1 ODI series win over SA

NEW DELHI: Abhishek Sharma’s strong form in T20 cricket this year continued as he became the first Indian batter to hit 100 sixes in the format in a single calendar year.The left-handed Punjab opener reached the mark while scoring 62 from 34 balls in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy (SMAT) Elite Group C match against Services. His innings included eight fours and three sixes, and he struck at 182.35.In T20s this year, Abhishek has made 1,499 runs at an average of 42.82 and a strike rate of 204.22. He has scored three centuries and nine fifties, with a highest score of 148, also made during the ongoing SMAT.In the current SMAT season, Abhishek has scored 304 runs at an average of 50.66 and a strike rate close to 250. His tally includes one century and two fifties, making him the second-highest run-scorer in the tournament.In the match against Services, Punjab were asked to bat first. They later put up 233/6 in 20 overs after a 106-run stand between Prabhsimran Singh and Abhishek. Prabhsimran scored 50 from 28 balls with seven fours and two sixes. Anmolpreet Singh added 34 off 23 balls with three fours and a six, while Naman Dhir made 54 off 22 balls with two fours and six sixes.For Services, Abhishek Tiwari and Vikas Gaur took two wickets each.Punjab won the match by 73 runs.Punjab are now placed at the top of Group C with 4 wins and 2 losses in 6 matches.
Article Summary: Abhishek Sharma becomes first Indian to hit 100 sixes in T20 cricket in a calendar year. Left-handed Punjab opener reached the mark while scoring 62 from 34 balls in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy (SMAT) Elite Group C match against Services.

Article Title: IND vs SA: Virat Kohli roasts Arshdeep Singh after India’s ODI series win over South Africa - Watch
Article Text:
Virat Kohli roasts Arshdeep Singh (Screengrabs)

Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel.

Gautam Gambhir Press Conference: Team India head coach heaves fire after 2-1 ODI series win over SA

Watch:

NEW DELHI: After India’s nine-wicket win over South Africa in Visakhapatnam sealed the ODI series 2-1, a light-hearted moment between Virat Kohli and Arshdeep Singh that quickly went viral.As players celebrated the comprehensive victory, Arshdeep jokingly told Kohli, “Few runs short, otherwise another century was confirmed for you.”Kohli instantly fired back, laughing, “It was good we won the toss, otherwise you would have also completed your century due to the dew!”The exchange reflected the relaxed aura around the Indian camp, especially with Kohli back at his dominant best.Kohli finished the series as the leading run-scorer with 302 runs, following hundreds in the first two games and an unbeaten 65 in the finale.More importantly for him, the innings symbolised a mental shift.“Honestly, playing the way I have in the series is the most satisfying thing for me. I feel really free in my mind. I haven't played like this in 2-3 years,” Kohli said after receiving the Player of the Series award.The former captain admitted that even seasoned players aren’t immune to self-doubt.“When you play for that long — 15-16 years — you do doubt yourself. Especially as a batter when one mistake can get you out. It's a whole journey of getting better and getting better as a person along the way.It improves you as a person and it improves temperament as well.”India’s win was shaped by their bowlers, with Prasidh Krishna (4/66) and Kuldeep Yadav (4/41) dismantling South Africa’s middle order after a strong start led by ton-up Quinton de Kock.With the ODI series wrapped up and spirits high, banter included, both teams now shift focus to the upcoming T20Is in Cuttack.
Article Summary: India beat South Africa by nine wickets in Visakhapatnam to win ODI series 2-1. Virat Kohli was the leading run-scorer in the series with 302 runs. Arshdeep Singh joked with Kohli that he should have scored more runs.

Article Title: Yashasvi Jaiswal hits ton as India thrash South Africa to clinch ODI series
Article Text:
Virat Kohli and Yashasvi Jaiswal after the third ODI cricket match against South Africa. (Image: AP Photo/Mahesh Kumar A.)

Gautam Gambhir Press Conference: Team India head coach heaves fire after 2-1 ODI series win over SA

VIZAG: KL Rahul was beaming after India won the toss for the first time in 21 matches. That change of luck proved a good omen as India rode on Yashasvi Jaiswal’s masterful maiden ODI century (116*; 121b, 12x4, 2x6) and another ‘Ro-Ko’ special to record a commanding nine-wicket victory over South Africa, sealing the series 2-1 in the bargain here at the ACA-VDCA stadium.India’s batters complemented the excellent show of their bowlers earlier in the afternoon. Prasidh Krishna (4/66) and Kuldeep Yadav (4/41) helped India skittle out the opposition for 270 in 47.5 overs. The full house that turned up in anticipation of a ‘Ro-Ko’ show got their money’s worth as Rohit Sharma (75; 73b, 7x4, 3x6) and Virat Kohli (65*; 45b, 6x4, 3x6) entertained the crowd with their trademark shots to ensure the hosts romped home in 39.5 overs.With dew being a major factor, Rahul gladly invited the opposition to bat and his bowlers did a fine job, despite Quinton de Kock smashing his 23rd ODI century (106; 89b, 8x4, 6x6), his seventh against India.Jaiswal and Rohit began the chase brilliantly with a big opening stand. Jaiswal hit Lungi Ngidi for a six straight over his head while Rohit walked down to the same bowler to despatch him for a maximum over deep midwicket.He then swept Keshav Maharaj for a boundary as India posted 48 for no loss in 10 overs. Rohit reached his half-century off 54 balls and took India to 102/0 in the 20th over. Rohit smoked Bosch for a six over deep square leg and at the other end, Jaiswal reached his half-century off 75 balls off Bosch and celebrated it with consecutive boundaries in the same over.Rohit, however, holed out to mid wicket off Keshav Maharaj in the 26th over. Kohli then entertained the crowd and the stadium erupted when he hit Bosch for a ‘no-look’ six in the 34th over. Jaiswal nudged Bosch for a single to reach his maiden century in 111 balls. At the other end, Kohli hit Bosch for a four to reach his fifty off 40 balls and sealed the match with consecutive boundaries off Ngidi.Earlier, Arshdeep Singh provided India the perfect start by dismissing Ryan Rickleton with the fifth ball of the innings. Harshit Rana and Arsh deep bowled tight lines and de Kock and Temba Bavuma chose to be cautious, taking their side to 42/1 in 10 overs. De Kock then launched into Prasidh, smashing him for 18 runs with back-to-back sixes and a boundary in the 11th over.De Kock and Bavuma added 113 runs and looked threatening before Jadeja broke the stand. He forced a false stroke off Bavuma (48; 67b, 5x4), who was caught at point by Kohli. But de Kock, who had poor outings in Ranchi and Raipur, looked in fine nick here, sweeping and pulling the bowlers with authority. He added 54 runs with Matthew Breetzke (24; 23b, 2x6).Prasidh, who also had a poor series so far, made amends with twin blows in the 29th over to check the Proteas’ progress. He first trapped Breetzke leg before and removed last match centurion Aiden Markram (1), who drove the bowler straight into the hands of Kohli at covers and reduced the visitors to 170/4."Honestly, playing the way I have in the series is the most satisfying thing for me. I feel really free in my mind. I haven’t played like this in 2-3 years. I know when I can bat like that in the middle, it helps the team a long way." — Virat Kohli | Player of the SeriesDe Kock hit Harshit for a six to reach his ton in 80 balls. But he soon perished when Prasidh rattled his stumps in the 33rd over. Kuldeep then put paid to SA’s hopes of posting a big total with the wickets of Dewald Bre vis (29) and Marco Jansen (17) in a span of three balls. Brevis was beaten by flight and was caught at mid-wicket while Jansen holed out to deep midwicket. Kuldeep did not allow the tail to wag as he dismissed Bosch and Lungi Ngidi in successive overs.
Article Summary: India beat South Africa by nine wickets in third ODI. Yashasvi Jaiswal scores maiden ODI century for India. Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli add 75 runs for the second wicket. Quinton de Kock scores 23rd ODI hundred for South Africa.

Article Title: 'Never doubt his calibre': Former India cricketer steps in to praise Virat Kohli after India seal ODI series against South Africa
Article Text:
Virat Kohli

NEW DELHI: Former India batter Mohammad Kaif praised star batter Virat Kohli after India’s win in the third ODI against South Africa, a result that gave the hosts a 2-1 series victory.India chased 271 with 10.1 overs left and nine wickets in hand. Yashasvi Jaiswal scored 116 not out off 121 balls and shared a 155-run opening stand with Rohit Sharma, who made 75 off 73. Kohli finished on 65 not out off 45 balls.Jaiswal’s hundred made him the sixth Indian men’s player to score centuries in all three international formats. The others are Suresh Raina, Rohit Sharma, KL Rahul, Virat Kohli, Shubman Gill and Yashasvi Jaiswal.Jaiswal was named Player of the Match, while Kohli won the Player of the Series award.After the match, Kaif posted on X: "Kohli is the legend of the game.. one should never doubt his calibre and form."He made the comment after Kohli’s unbeaten 65 helped India complete the chase and close the ODI series.In the match, India won the toss and elected to field first, sending South Africa in to bat. The Proteas posted 270 all out in 47.5 overs. While chasing 271, India's batters put on an excellent show. Jaiswal remained unbeaten on 116, supported by Rohit's 75 and Virat Kohli's 65, guiding India to a comfortable nine-wicket victory and sealing the series 2-1.
Article Summary: India beat South Africa by nine wickets in third ODI to win series 2-1. Yashasvi Jaiswal scored 116, supported by Rohit Sharma's 75 and Virat Kohli's 65. Kohli won the Player of the Series award. Former India batter Mohammad Kaif praised Kohli on Twitter.

Article Title: IND vs SA: First since 2013 - Rohit Sharma, Yashasvi Jaiswal end this 12-year drought against Proteas
Article Text:
Yashasvi Jaiswal and Rohit Sharma during the third ODI cricket match of a series between India and South Africa, at ACA-VDCA Cricket Stadium, in Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh. (PTI Photo)

Fans travel thousands of kilometres to watch Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma play

NEW DELHI: India, chasing a tricky target of 270 in the third ODI against South Africa in Visakhapatnam on Saturday, started well through Yashasvi Jaiswal and Rohit Sharma, who added 155 runs for the opening wicket.This was India’s 10th century opening stand against South Africa in ODIs, and the first since Rohit Sharma and Shikhar Dhawan put on 127 in the Champions Trophy 2013 match in Cardiff.That was also India's second-highest opening stand against SA in ODIs, only behind 193 between Sachin Tendulkar and Sourav Ganguly in Johannesburg in 2001.It was also the 35th time Rohit figured in a 100-run stand for the first wicket in ODIs. Only Sachin Tendulkar has more, with 40 such partnerships.The century stand was completed in the 20th over of India’s innings.India were 162/1 after 27 overs at the time of writing. Follow live updates Rohit Sharma also became the fourth Indian batter to reach 20,000 runs in men’s international cricket. He crossed the mark on the fourth ball of the 14th over of India’s chase.He joined Sachin Tendulkar, Virat Kohli and Rahul Dravid on the list Earlier, Kuldeep Yadav (4/41) and Prasidh Krishna (4/66) took eight wickets as India bowled out South Africa for 270, even as Quinton de Kock scored 106 in the third ODI.De Kock scored 106 off 89 balls with eight fours and six sixes. Captain Temba Bavuma made 48 from 67 balls with five fours. The other South African batters did not build on the start.Prasidh dismissed Matthew Breetzke (24) and Aiden Markram in the 29th over. Kuldeep took charge of the remaining wickets, removing the lower order.Kuldeep continued his run against South Africa in ODIs, recording his fifth four-wicket haul against them in the final match of the series.Kuldeep (11) also moved past former spinner Anil Kumble (10) and former fast bowler Javagal Srinath (10) to become the third Indian bowler with the most four-wicket (or more) hauls in ODIs.
Article Summary: Yashasvi Jaiswal and Rohit Sharma add 155 runs for the opening wicket. India were 162/1 after 27 overs at the time of writing. Quinton de Kock scored 106 off 89 balls with eight fours and six sixes. Captain Temba Bavuma made 48 from 67 balls with five fours.

Article Title: Arsenal's Premier League title charge suffers massive dent as Aston Villa end their 18-match unbeaten run
Article Text:
Aston Villa vs Arsenal (Photo by Alex Pantling/Getty Images)

Arsenal's Premier League title hopes suffered a setback as Aston Villa secured a 2-1 victory with Emiliano Buendia's stoppage-time winner on Saturday. The result reduced Villa's gap to league leaders Arsenal to three points, while also providing Manchester City an opportunity to gain ground on Arsenal.In the final moments at Villa Park, Buendia found the back of the net in the fifth minute of added time, leaving Arsenal shell-shocked."In the manner that happened at the end, obviously, (it is) really difficult to take," Arteta told TNT Sports.Arsenal's third consecutive away game without a win, following draws with Sunderland and Chelsea, has allowed rivals City and Villa to increase pressure at the top of the table.Villa moved to second place temporarily after winning nine of their last ten matches. This turnaround came after a challenging start under Unai Emery, where they failed to win their first five games."At the minute we're on a great run," said Matty Cash, who scored Villa's opener in the 36th. "We know it's not even Christmas yet, so we have to keep being demanding, keep being consistent, and then we'll see where it takes us."Arsenal's substitute Leandro Trossard equalized seven minutes into the second half.Buendia, who entered the game in the 87th minute, proved to be a game-changing substitution by scoring past Arsenal goalkeeper David Raya."We fight until the last minute, the last second, it was a really incredible win," he said.This marked only Arsenal's second defeat of the season, their first since losing 1-0 to Liverpool in August."We were 18 games unbeaten, and yet still the margin is so small," Arteta said. "We have to focus on ourselves and set the standards that today, particularly, individually we didn't raise that level. The effort was absolutely there and use that pain to go again."
Article Summary: Aston Villa defeated Arsenal 2-1 in the Premier League on Saturday. Emiliano Buendia scored a stoppage-time winner for Villa. The result reduced Arsenal's gap to three points at the top of the table. Villa moved to second place temporarily after winning nine of their last ten matches.

Article Title: 'We have to come up with another name for the NFL': Donald Trump
Article Text:
US President Donald Trump and Gianni Infantino, the president of FIFA, participate in the draw for the 2026 FIFA World Cup at the Kennedy Center in Washington (AFP Photo)

Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel.

Saurabh Netravalkar Interview: Gets emotional about playing at Wankhede, for USA; ILT20 and more

Riding the excitement of the 2026 FIFA World Cup, US President Donald Trump on Friday suggested that American football should be renamed, arguing that the game played with a round ball — soccer — is the sport that truly deserves the name "football.""We have a little bit of a conflict with another thing that's called football but when you think about it, shouldn't it really be called ... football, there is no question. We have to come up with another name for the NFL (National Football League)," Trump said at the World Cup draw."It really doesn't make sense when you think about it."In the United States, "football" refers to American football — a sport played largely with the hands and vastly different from the game the rest of the world knows as football.Every year, millions of Americans tune in to watch the NFL’s championship game, the Super Bowl. During the event, FIFA President Gianni Infantino reminded the US audience that the 2026 World Cup would be the equivalent of "104 Super Bowls."Trump, known for his interest in a variety of sports, has increasingly embraced soccer as the 2026 World Cup — set to be hosted by the United States, Mexico and Canada — draws closer.
Article Summary: US President Donald Trump suggested that American football should be renamed. Trump argued that the game played with a round ball — soccer — is the sport that truly deserves the name "football" FIFA President Gianni Infantino reminded the US audience that the 2026 World Cup would be the equivalent of "104 Super Bowls"

Article Title: FIFA World Cup 2026: Coaches react to group stage draw
Article Text:
Defending champions Argentina and strong contenders Spain received favourable draws for the 2026 World Cup during a star-studded ceremony. (AP Photo)

NEW DELHI: Defending champions Argentina and strong contenders Spain received favourable draws for the 2026 World Cup during a star-studded ceremony.Lionel Messi’s Argentina will kick off their title defense — following their triumph in Qatar 2022 — against Algeria, before facing Austria and debutants Jordan in Group J.Spain, European champions and among the tournament favorites, will begin their campaign against first-time qualifiers Cape Verde, with Uruguay and Saudi Arabia completing Group H.Two-time winners France face challenging tests in Group I against Senegal and Erling Haaland’s Norway, with the group rounded out by an intercontinental play-off winner from Iraq, Bolivia, or Suriname.For the first time, the draw was structured to keep the four highest-ranked teams apart — meaning Spain, Argentina, France, and England cannot meet before the semi-finals, should they all top their respective groups.Key reactions from coaches after the 2026 World Cup draw in Washington on Friday:Roberto Martinez, coach of Portugal. Drawn with Uzbekistan, a qualifier and Colombia in Group K:"I think contenders is the right word. But I think the favorites are the teams that have won the World Cup before because there is a psychological aspect... I think we have to grow still, but we are full of hope and excitement."The 1966 team of Eusebio is the reference point for us... We have won the European Championship and the Nations League and now I think it is very important that we should be able to fight for the dream we all have, to do something we have never done before."On Cristiano Ronaldo's longevity: "I think the secret he has is that he works every day as if it were the last day of his career... He never loses his hunger, he is an example for all of us. He is our captain, a reference for us, and very important for us."Walid Regragui, coach of Morocco. Drawn with Brazil, Scotland and Haiti in Group C."We're playing against one of the favorites (Brazil) right from the start, and they are playing one of the favorites right from the start," a confident Regragui said of Morocco's opening match against the five-time World Cup winners."Whatever happens, Brazil remain Brazil. They are always potential winners. Having one of the potential winners in our group, and to play them in the first game, is never easy. They have picked up one of best coaches in the world (Carlo Ancelotti) with lots of experience -- he will give them serenity. We will try to be up to the task to make our fans proud."Steve Clarke, coach of Scotland. Drawn with Brazil, Morocco and Haiti in Group C:"Brazil are an institution, if you like, they are one of the top teams. You always want to play against Brazil, so we have the chance to do that and I am pretty sure we will give them a good game."It will be a tough game as always -- it will be (the) third game in the group. Hopefully we (will) have some points in the bag before we play them, but to get to a World Cup for a country like Scotland, it has taken us a long time to get back here -- 1998 was the last time, so we were determined to get there and do well... Every game in the World Cup is special –- we don't get there very often so every game is special for us."Bubista, coach of first-time qualifiers Cape Verde. Drawn with Spain, Saudi Arabia and Uruguay in Group H:"We want to show people who we are (and) play with heart, a good attitude and a lot of humility. It is not a matter of being afraid of Spain. I am pleased to be playing against Spain because I played in Spain for (club side) Badajoz. It is just about enjoying the game, against a team we obviously need to be very wary of."It means a lot for us, for our country –- everyone will be watching. Our country will be better known around the world... We won our qualifying group and we are very proud to be in our first World Cup."Dick Advocaat, coach of Curacao, also making their World Cup debut. Drawn with Germany,Ivory Coast and Ecuador in Group E:"Three difficult teams for us but in principle every game is difficult. It is exciting to play there at the highest level and we will see what we can do."One thing is that we have a team with a lot of fighters and I know from experience we are always difficult to beat, so every opponent we come up against will have to play very well. It is exciting for the island, the people are so proud."
Article Summary: Defending champions Argentina and strong contenders Spain received favourable draws for the 2026 World Cup. Lionel Messi’s Argentina will kick off their title defense against Algeria, before facing Austria and debutants Jordan in Group J. Spain, European champions and among the tournament favorites, will begin their campaign against first-time qualifiers Cape Verde.

NEW DELHI: Defending champions Argentina and European powerhouse Spain received favourable group draws for the 2026 World Cup during a star-studded ceremony that also saw U.S. President Donald Trump awarded FIFA’s new peace prize.The draw, held at the Kennedy Center in Washington, marked the official countdown to the expanded 48-team tournament, now just six months away.Lionel Messi and Argentina will open their title defense against Algeria, with further group-stage fixtures against Austria and tournament debutants Jordan in Group J.Spain, among the leading contenders and current European champions, will begin their campaign against first-time qualifiers Cape Verde before facing Uruguay and Saudi Arabia in Group H."All the praise will not weaken us, quite the opposite," insisted Spain coach Luis de la Fuente."We want to do something big at this World Cup and that means making sure we do well in the group stage, then carrying on from there."Thomas Tuchel's England, seeking to win the World Cup for the first time since 1966, will hope to win Group L that features beaten 2018 finalists Croatia as well as Ghana and Panama.Two-time winners France, meanwhile, face awkward tests against Senegal and Erling Haaland's Norway in Group I, which will be completed by an intercontinental play-off winner from either Iraq, Bolivia or Suriname.For the first time, the draw was done in such a way as to ensure the four highest-ranked nations were kept apart -- Spain, Argentina, France and England cannot meet before the semi-finals, if all four top their groups.However, the path to that stage -- with an extra knockout round now following the group phase -- looks perilous for some of the contenders.If the top seeds all finish first in their groups, England could, for example, find themselves playing co-hosts Mexico in Mexico City in the last 16 and then Brazil in the quarter-finals, before a last-four clash with Argentina.The tournament will be held across the United States, Mexico and Canada from June 11 to July 19, with 16 more teams added to the global showpiece, up from the 32 nations involved in 2022.That means a total of 104 matches, compared to 64 games last time.While the US will host the majority of matches including the final at the MetLife Stadium outside New York, three of the 16 venues will be in Mexico and two in Canada.The three hosts have experienced turbulent relations since Trump came to power but he brushed that aside."We've worked closely with those two countries, and the coordination and friendship and relationship has been outstanding," Trump said after receiving his peace prize from FIFA president Gianni Infantino."It is truly one of the great honors of my life. It is such an honor to be with Gianni. He has done such an incredible job," Trump added.Trump seized the limelight, even dancing when the Village People performed, but Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney and Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum were also in attendance.The event was co-hosted by supermodel Heidi Klum and American actor and comedian Kevin Hart. NFL legend Tom Brady, ice hockey icon Wayne Gretzky and former NBA superstar Shaquille O'Neal were among the stars who helped conduct the draw.Co-hosts Mexico will take on South Africa in Group A in the opening game of the tournament at the Estadio Azteca in Mexico City on June 11.Carlo Ancelotti's Brazil and surprise 2022 semi-finalists Morocco came out together in Group C, which also features Scotland and Haiti.Germany's opponents in Group E will be Ivory Coast, Ecuador and Caribbean minnows Curacao, while Cristiano Ronaldo's Portugal will face Uzbekistan, Colombia and a play-off winner.Co-hosts the United States got a manageable draw, with Paraguay, Australia and a European play-off winner in Group D.The top two teams in each group advance to the last 32, joined by the eight best third-placed teams."It will be the greatest World Cup ever," Infantino claimed. "This is like 104 Super Bowls in one month -- this is the magnitude of what we are organizing."Because of the complexity, teams will only learn the full details of their match venues and kick-off times on Saturday.The 12 groups for the 2026 World Cup in the United States, Canada and Mexico from June 11 to July 19, 2026 following Friday's draw in Washington:Mexico, South Africa, South Korea, a qualifierCanada, a qualifier, Qatar, SwitzerlandBrazil, Morocco, Haiti, ScotlandUnited States, Paraguay, Australia, a qualifierGermany, Curacao, Ivory Coast, EcuadorNetherlands, Japan, a qualifier, TunisiaBelgium, Egypt, Iran, New ZealandSpain, Cape Verde, Saudi Arabia, UruguayFrance, Senegal, qualifier, NorwayArgentina, Algeria, Austria, JordanPortugal, a qualifier, Uzbekistan, ColombiaEngland, Croatia, Ghana, Panama

Article Title: Indian football in limbo: ISL clubs urge AIFF to act amid revenue crisis
Article Text:
AIFF logo

NEW DELHI: Twelve Indian Super League (ISL) clubs have approached the All India Football Federation (AIFF) with urgent concerns about the domestic football crisis. The situation has become critical as the Marketing Rights Agreement between AIFF and Football Sports Development Limited expires on December 8.The affected clubs include FC Goa, Sporting Club Delhi, NorthEast United FC, Jamshedpur FC, Bengaluru FC, Mohun Bagan Super Giant, Chennauyin FC, Mumbai City FC, Kerala Blasters, Punjab FC, Odisha FC, and Mohammedan Sporting.Inter Kashi, a newly promoted team, have also joined the initiative."While majority of the clubs have continued to honour salaries and contractual dues to players and staff in good faith, the current position is not merely challenging it is approaching commercial impossibility and risks rendering ongoing operations untenable," the clubs stated in their letter to AIFF president Kalyan Chaubey."For nearly eleven years, ISL clubs have continued to invest substantially in football in India despite persistent losses on strength of a predictable league structure and, most critically, central revenue. This revenue stream has historically been the principal source of income that enabled clubs to manage salaries, infrastructure, and sporting operations."With the expiry of the MRA and the consequent absence of a commercial rights holder, central revenue has ceased entirely.The uncertainty has also caused local sponsors to withdraw or pause commercial commitments, leaving clubs with no viable income whatsoever, despite ongoing obligations."The clubs have recommended that AIFF collaborate with the government to address these issues. They suggest submitting proposed actions to sports minister Mansukh Mandaviya before December 8 to inform the Supreme Court about remedial measures."... time is now of the essence. The viability of the clubs and indeed the future of the ISL and the Indian football ecosystem depends on immediate steps being placed before the Hon'ble Supreme Court. It is, therefore, imperative that the report of the Union of India and/or the AIFF on the actions proposed to be taken in respect of the issues highlighted herein be filed on or before 8 December 2025, so that the Court is apprised of the remedial pathway and commercial certainty can be restored without further delay," it added.The clubs expressed concern that any delay beyond the specified date could severely damage the football ecosystem developed over the past decade.AIFF responded by confirming they would forward the concerns to the Ministry of Sports and engage KPMG to develop solutions, including a possible re-tender."The AIFF shall also put in all possible effort as per our AIFF Constitution to ensure ISL gets a long-term sustainable model for growth and development of Indian football. We are also forwarding this mail to KPMG to work on a suitable solution, including the possibility of issuing a re-tender keeping time constraints in mind," the letter read.The clubs have filed an Interim Application with the Supreme Court to address constitutional impediments affecting the tender process."Should the Court process take time, we urge that the AIFF consider exercising this power with utmost urgency, in consultation with the Government where necessary, so that the sport is not imperilled by procedural delay."The AIFF plans to hold its Annual General Body Meeting on December 20. A previous tender for selecting a new ISL commercial partner was unsuccessful.The clubs have suggested forming a consortium to operate the league if a new tender fails to attract suitable partners."Such an approach is consistent with global best practices and reflective of the long-term commitment of the Clubs to Indian football," the clubs stated."It must be conducted within a strict and non-extendable timeline, such that the process is completed well before the end of this month. Only a hard time-bound tender window of this nature provides any realistic opportunity to stabilise the commercial structure of the league and salvage the current season. Beyond the re-tender itself, we respectfully submit that a long-term solution must be formulated without delay. A temporary or stop-gap arrangement ... momentary relief but does not address the underlying structural issues."
Article Summary: 12 Indian Super League (ISL) clubs have approached the All India Football Federation (AIFF) with urgent concerns about the domestic football crisis. The situation has become critical as the Marketing Rights Agreement between AIFF and Football Sports Development Limited expires on December 8. The affected clubs include FC Goa, Sporting Club Delhi, NorthEast United FC, Jamshedpur FC, Bengaluru FC, Mohun Bagan Super Giant, Chennauyin FC, Mumbai City FC.

Article Title: FIFA to honour President Donald Trump at World Cup 2026 draw ceremony
Article Text:
US President Donald Trump and FIFA President Gianni Infantino. (Image: X/WhiteHouse)

Donald Trump to receive inaugural FIFA Peace Prize

Ceremony hosts & performers

Teams & tournament format

Lionel Messi hopes to participate as Argentina defend title

The 2026 FIFA World Cup draw ceremony will take place in Washington on Friday at the Kennedy Center, featuring U.S. President Donald Trump receiving the inaugural FIFA Peace Prize. The ceremony, starting at 1700 GMT, will include American sports stars and entertainment celebrities for the first-ever 48-team World Cup finals to be hosted across North America from June 11 to July 19.The expanded tournament will include 16 more teams than the 2022 Qatar World Cup, making it the most logistically complex World Cup in history. The matches will be played across 16 venues, with 11 in the United States, three in Mexico, and two in Canada.FIFA President Gianni Infantino has established a close relationship with Trump, who will receive the FIFA Peace Prize during the ceremony. According to Infantino, the award is "to recognize the enormous efforts of those individuals who unite people, bringing hope for future generations."Trump, who recently became chairman of the Kennedy Center, has made the World Cup a centerpiece event of both his second presidency and the 250th anniversary of U.S.independence next year. However, he has threatened to relocate World Cup matches from Democratic-run cities if he deems conditions unsafe."I would call Gianni, the head of FIFA, who's phenomenal, and I would say, let's move it to another location. And he would do that," Trump stated recently.The star-studded ceremony will be co-hosted by supermodel Heidi Klum and actor-comedian Kevin Hart. It will feature performances by Village People, Andrea Bocelli, Nicole Scherzinger, and Robbie Williams, while sports icons Tom Brady, Wayne Gretzky, and Shaquille O'Neal will help conduct the draw.Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney and Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum will attend the ceremony. Iran initially threatened to boycott but later decided to send representatives, including head coach Amir Ghalenoei, after visa issues for some delegation members.Iranian Football Federation president Mehdi Taj criticized the U.S. visa decision as "purely political" before Iran's change of stance regarding ceremony attendance.The tournament's expansion has enabled first-time qualifiers like Cape Verde, Jordan, and Curacao to participate. FIFA's head of global football development Arsene Wenger defended the expansion, calling it a "natural evolution" and stating that 48 teams is "the right number."The teams will be divided into 12 groups of four, with the top two from each group and eight best third-placed teams advancing to the last 32. The draw will ensure the four highest-ranked nations - Spain, Argentina, France, and England - cannot meet before the semi-finals if they top their groups.Argentina, the reigning champions, will be among the top seeds alongside European champions Spain, Brazil, France, Germany, England, Portugal, the Netherlands, Belgium, and the three host nations.Lionel Messi, who will turn 39 during the tournament, expressed hope about participating. "I hope I can be there. I've said before that I'd love to be there," Messi told ESPN.Six finals berths remain undecided and will be determined through playoffs. The playoff winners will be among the bottom seeds, potentially including Italy, who failed to qualify for the last two tournaments despite being World Cup winners in 2006.The opening match will be held at Mexico City's Azteca Stadium, with the final at the MetLife Stadium (NJ) outside New York City. Due to the tournament's complexity, teams will learn their complete match venues and kickoff times the day after the draw.
Article Summary: The 2026 FIFA World Cup draw will take place in Washington on Friday. U.S. President Donald Trump will receive the inaugural FIFA Peace Prize. The expanded tournament will include 16 more teams than the 2022 Qatar World Cup. The matches will be played across 16 venues, with 11 in the United States, three in Mexico, and two in Canada.

Article Title: Lionel Messi eyes MLS Cup title as Inter Miami clash with Vancouver Whitecaps

Inter Miami, led by Lionel Messi , will face the Vancouver Whitecaps in the Major League Soccer championship final on Saturday at Chase Stadium in Fort Lauderdale, where four World Cup winners including Messi, Thomas Mueller, Sergio Busquets, and Rodrigo De Paul will compete for domestic glory.The 38-year-old Argentine has guided Miami through an impressive playoff run, with the team scoring 17 goals in five games.Vancouver presents a formidable challenge with German star Thomas Mueller, who joined in August, enhancing their attacking prowess.Mueller has dismissed suggestions of a personal rivalry with Messi ahead of the final."It's not about Messi against Thomas Mueller," Mueller stated after Vancouver's 3-1 victory in the Western Conference final. "It's Miami against the Whitecaps."Miami's journey to the final appeared unlikely in April when Javier Mascherano's team managed only two wins in eight games, including a 5-1 aggregate loss to Vancouver in the CONCACAF Champions Cup.At that time, broadcast analysts criticized the team harshly: "They can't run, they can't defend, and there's not a balance in the team."Miami has since undergone a remarkable transformation, strengthened by De Paul's addition in midfield and Mascherano's decision to start 19-year-old Mateo Silvetti over veteran Luis Suarez.Whitecaps coach Jesper Sorensen downplayed the significance of their earlier victories against Miami."It almost seems like it was last season, right?" Sorensen said. "It's a new game. "Playing at home is a plus. Even though we went through a stretch where we were very inconsistent and struggled to win back-to-back games, at home we always stayed strong."Mueller, who has historically dominated encounters with Messi, winning seven out of their ten meetings, including the 2014 World Cup final and Bayern Munich's 8-2 victory over Barcelona in the 2020 Champions League."I look back in the past and I feel very comfortable with that, because that's already in the books, and I had a lot of great experience in these games with my teams, so it was fun," Mueller reflected on his previous matches against Messi. "But it doesn't really matter for Saturday, it's a new game."The final represents a clash between Miami's resurgent form and Vancouver's dynamic attack, with both teams aiming to write their names in MLS history.

Article Title: Why did the NFL hit Isiah Pacheco with one of the season’s biggest fines for a routine helmet collision?
Article Text:
Running back Isiah Pacheco was fined $46,371 for impermissibly lowering his helmet on a hit, a penalty not called during the game. This retroactive discipline, impacting other players too, highlights the NFL's strict enforcement of helmet contact rules, raising questions about player responsibility and the league's policing of instinctive plays.

League crackdown on helmet contact puts spotlight on unclear enforcement

Isiah Pacheco has earned a reputation as one of the most fearlessly physical running backs in the league, but his latest collision with Cowboys cornerback DaRon Bland brought a consequence many around the NFL didn’t see coming. Despite the play looking like a standard sideline hit, officials later ruled that Pacheco “impermissibly lowered his helmet,” leading to a hefty $46,371 fine.What makes the situation more controversial is that there was no penalty on the field, no special emphasis from commentators, and no visible concern from the Cowboys defense. It was the sort of moment that typically goes unnoticed, until the league decides it shouldn’t.This quiet crackdown by the NFL fuels a growing debate: how much responsibility should players bear for a split-second decision during a fast, instinctive play? And if the league interprets helmet use differently than the players executing those hits, where is the real line?The fine issued to Pacheco is not only far above the standard starting penalty of $22,500 for a first offense, it also raises suspicions that the NFL classified it as either a repeat violation or an “especially egregious” action. Yet to most watching, it wasn’t a crown-of-the-helmet blow or an intentional strike at all. It was a running back bracing for contact.This isn’t an isolated development. Similar fines have recently impacted Zach Charbonnet and Saquon Barkley, both disciplined retroactively despite no in-game flags. For players, it highlights a widening gap between how football feels in real time and how the NFL polices it after slow-motion review.The league says the rule enforces a broader goal of preventing head and neck trauma. That mission is valid, but the question now becomes whether the NFL can protect players without punishing the instinctive mechanics of the sport itself. For the Chiefs, Pacheco’s situation isn’t just a financial hit, it’s a reminder that even the most routine play can become a high-priced judgment call in today’s NFL.Also Read: Dak Prescott reflects on racist encounter before NFL draft while emerging as Dallas’ franchise leader
Article Summary: Isiah Pacheco was fined $46,371 for impermissibly lowering his helmet on a hit, a penalty not called during the game. This retroactive discipline, impacting other players too, highlights the NFL's strict enforcement of helmet contact rules. Similar fines have recently impacted Zach Charbonnet and Saquon Barkley.

Article Title: “Not what I dreamed of”: Gisele Bündchen reflects on her marriage to Tom Brady with honesty and acceptance years after their split
Article Text:

A marriage she hoped would last, and a life she has learned to embrace

When Gisele Bündchen opened up about her divorce from Tom Brady in 2023, it marked one of the first times the supermodel allowed the public a genuine look at how she felt about the end of one of Hollywood’s most followed marriages. At that time, Bündchen had just turned 43 and was settling into a new rhythm outside of her 13-year marriage to the NFL legend.While the breakup sparked countless rumors, especially around Brady’s return to football, she made it clear that the truth was far more personal and less dramatic than tabloids wanted it to be. Looking back now, her reflections stand out not as regret, but as perspective shaped by growth, motherhood, and acceptance.In her interview with “CBS News Sunday Morning,” Bündchen didn’t portray herself as heartbroken or angry. Instead, she admitted to grieving a future she once imagined. “It’s not what I dreamed of and what I hoped for,” she said candidly, emphasizing that her parents’ 50-year marriage set the example she wished to follow.Yet her tone wasn’t bitter. It was reflective, acknowledging that time changes people, and not all unions last simply because they begin with love.She explained that life evolves and couples don’t always grow in the same direction. “Sometimes you grow together, sometimes you grow apart,” she reflected, a line that would later resonate with many women navigating similar transitions. After their divorce was finalized in 2022, Bündchen rejected public speculation that Brady’s football comeback caused their split, dismissing it as “the craziest thing I’ve ever heard. ”Instead, she focused on gratitude for their children and the life they built. “I mean, he’s the father of my kids, you know? So I always wish him the best,” she said, praising the family they created and the lessons gained from their marriage.Since then, Bündchen has built a new lifestyle prioritizing family, wellness, and independence, from creating a solar-powered home to co-parenting peacefully. Her perspective, especially now, offers a quiet reminder that endings don’t always carry sadness, sometimes they simply make room for a different kind of life, one she says she “wouldn’t change absolutely anything” about.Also Read: Tom Brady “got screwed” for ignoring the biggest red flag in his marriage: Gisele Bündchen’s past with Leonardo DiCaprio

Chicago Bulls’ injury nightmare worsens as Noa Essengue’s season ends abruptly

Bulls’ struggles grow as Essengue’s strong G-League form is halted by injury

In a matter of days, they went from being at the top of the Eastern Conference to being relegated to the play-in spots. The Chicago Bulls' season has been a real roller coaster. Furthermore, Chicago has battled with several injuries, which have limited the rotation. Now comes another huge setback: the season-ending loss of one of their best promising prospects.Rookie Noa Essengue, taken 12th overall in the NBA Draft, has seen his progress interrupted abruptly. According to reports from the United States, Essengue sustained the injury during a game with the Windy City Bulls, where he had been performing well and prepared for a gradual integration later this year.The Chicago Bulls are facing two tough truths. A five-game losing streak and numerous players out with injury. One of the athletes is Noa Essengue, an 18-year-old rookie. However, his season ended due to shoulder surgery, according to the NBA.The official notice of the team read:“Noa Essengue Medical Update Chicago Bulls forward Noa Essengue will undergo left shoulder surgery and be out for the remainder of the season. Updates will be provided as appropriate…”Additionally, according to head coach Billy Donovan, he saw an issue and asked Essengue to solve it straight away.“I think the recommendation was to get it fixed now instead of waiting, because it’s something that could continue to be a problem for him… The decision was made pretty much some time today.”With a great 6-1 start, Chicago appeared to be on a new path right away. They are now between the ages of 9 and 12, and the situation appears dismal.Injuries are obviously a factor. Many of its important players, including Coby White, Josh Giddey, Ayo Dosunmu, Patrick Williams, Isaac Okoro, and Kevin Huerter, have been sidelined due to injuries.The Bulls are also without forwards Coby White (left calf strain), Kevin Huerter (left hamstring strain), Zach Collins (left scaphoid fracture), and Jalen Smith (left hamstring strain), as well as guards Isaac Okoro and Tre Jones.On November 22, Essengue made his Bulls debut against the Washington Wizards. Overall, he went 0-for-3 from the field and played six minutes in two games. He played 30.8 minutes per game with the NBA G League's Windy City Bulls, averaging 23 points and 8.5 rebounds.Essengue was the No. 12 pick in the NBA Draft this summer, coming from France. Chicago suffered a 113-103 setback to the Brooklyn Nets on Wednesday. On Friday, they will face the Indiana Pacers, followed by the Golden State Warriors on Sunday.Essengue averaged 23 points, 8.5 rebounds, and 30.8 minutes per game while playing for the G-League Windy City Bulls.
